subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Tuesday, April 10, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

House committee subpoenas U.S. attorney
documents

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Stepping up
congressional pressure on Attorney Gen. Alberto Gonzales, the
House Judiciary Committee Tuesday issued a subpoena demanding
additional internal Justice Department documents relating to
the firing of eight federal U.S. attorneys.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/house-committee-subpoenas-us-attorney.html

***

House committee to examine Pentagon's Tillman,
Lynch stories

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- A House
committee announced Tuesday it will examine how the Pentagon
ended up spreading false stories about the capture of Army
private Jessica Lynch and the death of NFL star-turned-soldier
Pat Tillman. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/house-committee-to-examine-pentagons.html

***

Bush says he will meet with leaders of both
parties on military funding

FAIRFAX, Virginia
(CNN) -- President Bush said Tuesday he will invite
congressional leaders from both parties to the White House next
week to discuss the status of supplemental military funding
legislation.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/bush-says-he-will-meet-with-leaders-of.html

***

Reid: 'We are speaking for the American
people, he isn't'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Senate
Majority Leader Harry Reid, D-Nevada, indicated Democrats
weren't yielding on their Iraq stance Tuesday, the same day
President Bush invited lawmakers from both parties to the White
House next week to discuss the Iraq spending bill.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/reid-we-are-speaking-for-american.html

***

Kerry, Gingrich square off on global
warming

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Two political
heavy-weights on opposite end of he the political spectrum
debated the topic of global warming Tuesday, the latest sign
the controversial issue is heating up on Capitol Hill.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/kerry-gingrich-square-off-on-global.html

***

White House: Imus was right to apologize for
comments

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The White House
is weighing in on the heated controversy surrounding radio-talk
show host Don Imus, saying Tuesday that he was right to
apologize for his comments about the Rutgers women's basketball
team.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/white-house-imus-was-right-to.html

***

Giuliani: I'd appear on Imus' radio show
again

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former New York
City Mayor Rudy Giuliani called embattled radio talk show host
Don Imus to talk about comments he made about the Rutgers
women's basketball team, the Republican presidential contender
told a group of reporters Tuesday at Alabama's State Capitol.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/giuliani-id-appear-on-imus-radio-show.html

***

Schneider: Could Bush 'triangulate' on
immigration?

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- What kind of
challenge does immigration reform pose for President Bush?
Everybody favors better border security. The issue is what to
do about the millions of illegal immigrants already in the
United States.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/schneider-could-bush-triangulate-on.html

***

McCain touts support from four former
secretaries of state

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen.
John McCain, R-Arizona, rolled out the endorsements of four
former secretaries of state Monday, the latest effort by the
presidential candidate to highlight his foreign policy
credentials.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/mccain-touts-support-from-four-former.html

***

Romney plans call for more robust defense
spending

BOSTON (AP) -- Republican Mitt
Romney believes the United States needs to increase its defense
spending, refocus its alliances on terrorism and reduce
bureaucracy so U.S. organizations can do good works across the
globe.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/04/romney-plans-call-for-more-robust.html
